intro: Qualea amapaensis, commonly known as the Amapa yellowwood, is a flowering plant native to the Amazon Basin of South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its woody structure and small, yellowish flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, tropical environments and is often found in swampy or flooded areas. Its leaves are simple and ovate, with a smooth margin, while its fruits are capsules that release seeds when mature. Qualea amapaensis plays a role in the ecological dynamics of its habitat, contributing to the biodiversity of the region.
